description: Middle English jambe, jaumbe, French jambe.

entries.meaning: (heraldry) A leg, of an animal or person.
examples: [Image of a human leg in armor.] Crest - A jambe, unarmed, excepting the spur, quarterly, or and sa.

entries.meaning: (often in the plural) Synonym of jambeau (“a greave”).
examples: […]  cuissarts or cuisses were used to shield the thigh, and boots of steel called greaves or jambes were worn upon the leg between the ancle[sic] and the knee. We have no doubt that the jambes were found to act well as preserves, but we think at times the shin must have been sadly jammed in them.
